entry.title: Optimizing A Vue App
entry.summary: Prioritizing performance when building our web apps improves the user experience and helps ensure they can be used by as many people as possible. In this article, Michelle Barker will walk you through some of the front-end optimization tips to keep our Vue apps as efficient as possible.

entry.title: A Guide To Keyboard Accessibility: JavaScript (Part 2)
entry.summary: This article is the second of two parts about a guide to making websites accessible to keyboard users. Here Cristian Diaz covers a toolset on JavaScript that you can mix into different components to create a great experience for keyboard users.

entry.title: Making Static Noise From a Weird CSS Gradient Bug
entry.summary: What I will be doing here is kind of an experiment to explore tricks that leverage a bug with the way CSS gradients handle sub-pixel rendering to create a static noise effect — like you might see on a TV with no signal. Making Static Noise From a Weird CSS Gradient Bug originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Do NOT Plug This Into Anything – Hak5 Rubber Ducky
entry.summary:
Visit https://www.squarespace.com/LTT and use offer code LTT for 10% off
Create your build at https://www.buildredux.com/linus
The Hak5 Rubber Ducky is a dangerous hacking tool that disguises itself as an unassuming USB flash drive. It delivers payloads by injecting keystrokes while appearing to its host system as a regular old keyboard.
Discuss on the forum: https://linustechtips.com/topic/1467579-do-not-plug-this-into-anything-%E2%80%93-hak5-rubber-ducky/
